results.title: Adding or removing refrigerent
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett, F.E. Brooker and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
A refrigeration training film providing instruction on checking a domestic refrigeration system for lack of refrigerant, adding refrigerant for leak testing, how to add refrigerant by weight, adding an unmeasured amount and how to remove a refrigerant.

results.title: Adaptive radiation: the mollusks
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Illustrates the principles of adaptive radiation and shows how the typical molluscan characteristics are modified in each of the six classes. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Adaptations of insects. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Shows the ways in which insects are adapted to their environments. Considers the functions of legs, mouths, breathing organs and camouflage in allowing the various insects to survive in the particular environments. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Adaptation
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Intermedia, Edward Saxon, Vincent Landay, Jonathan Demme and Spike Jonze
results.brief_description: From the creators of “Being John Malkovich” - director Spike Jonze and screenwriter Charlie Kaufman - comes the strangely twisted tale of woe of a screenwriter given the task of adapting a novel to the screen. In a desperate struggle, he actually writes himself (and his twin brother) into the story and reality and fiction start to blur, creating some dramatic and at times, comic situations. Cast includes Nicholas Cage, Meryl Streep and Chris Cooper (Academy Award Winner Best Supporting Actor for this role). Screenplay by Charlie and Donald Kaufman. “Adaptation” is also winner of two Golden Globe Awards. Based on the book “The Orchard Thief” by Susan Orlean.

results.title: Adam Smith and The Wealth of Nations
results.creator_credit: Jean Wadlow, Charles Barker Films, Liberty Fund and John Haggarty
results.brief_description: Studies the life and works of Adam Smith, the Scottish political economist and philosopher whose book “The Wealth of Nations” was completed two hundred years ago. Outlines many of Smith’s most interesting and controversial theories.

results.title: Adam's rib
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Weingarten, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and George Cukor
results.brief_description: Katharine Hepburn plays Amanda Bonner, the defence attorney in the trial of Doris Attinger for the attempted murder of her husband whom she discovers has a mistress. Spencer Tracy is Amanda’s husband, Adam, prosecuting attorney in the same trial. As the trial progresses, Amanda and Adam find they cannot confine their battle to the courtroom, as the issues of sexual equality extend into their home. Also starring Judy Holliday and Tom Ewell.

results.title: Acupuncture: an exploration
results.creator_credit: Permagum Productions, FilmFair Communications and Franklin Konigsberg
results.brief_description: Describes current experiments confirming the effectiveness of acupuncture points. Theories are given explaining its success as an analgesic for surgery, also an outline on the history of acupuncture is briefly explained.

results.title: Acupuncture
results.creator_credit: Brian Beaton, Celia Tait, SBS-TV and Reel Images
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
The emphasis of acupuncture is on prevention rather than cure. First documented in ancient Chinese texts, acupuncture can be combined with other therapies to alleviate pain and is often used instead of anaesthesia. Cupping and acupressure use acupuncture techniques without the insertion of needles.

results.title: Acupuncture
results.creator_credit: Weng Jeng-Yih, Keta Communications and Lin Sheng-Lung
results.brief_description: Acupuncture and moxibustion in China have recorded histories of several thousand years. They are effective, convenient and safe treatments. Many people regard both treatments as one and the same, but they are in fact two distinct treatments that are often used together. Acupuncture is a corrective therapy and moxibustion is the burning of herbs on acupuncture points to bring healing relief. This is a in-depth analysis of these two healing methods, how they are applied and their increasing acceptance as efficacious treatments in Western medicine.
